result.title: Modelling guideline document and demonstration development kit
result.description: Deliverable D4.4 (and thus, D4.6) is a “cookbook” guideline document for transforming developed models into a suitable form for the optimisations of WP5. This guideline is not restricted to the use case, but will rather take into account the generalisability of the model-based decomposition-coordination optimisation. The deliverable will include a demonstration implementation.

result.title: Revised Data Management Plan
result.description:
"In month 6 the deliverable “Data Management Plan” (DMP) was submitted based on available guidelines and the GA. The Data Management Plan is considered a living document resulting in an updated version.
On 15 February 2016 the EC provided/published the first substantial guidance in form of the “Guidelines on Data Management in Horizon 2020 (Version 2.1)."" As a result a new deliverable ORDP Data Management Plan was required (in order to unblock the ongoing amendment process):
Although GA option for open research pilot (""Article 29.3 - Open access to research data"") is selected there is NO deliverable with type ""ORDP: Open Research Data Pilot"" defined.
After discussing this with our current PO Damian BORNAS CAYUELA on 03.03.16, the following solution was approved:
A new deliverable 1.8 “Revised Data Managementplan” will be included which will be due to month 18 – before the mid-term review. This deliverable will be marked ORDP "

result.title: ICT Reference Architecture
result.description: The ICT Reference Architecture is designed as a central element for a joint approach to smart city implementation within the three lighthouse cities and the follower cities. The ICT reference architecture provides high-level blueprint of architecture of the commonalities and differences and gives a global picture for the involved cities towards the provisioning of intelligent services for the mobility, energy and building aspects of the project.

result.title: Overview on market design options for European electricity markets
result.description: This deliverable describes and discusses different market design options, which are already in place in different EU-member states, but also the ones that are strongly discussed and are expected to be introduced in some EU-countries. These design options cover i.a. energy-only-markets (EOM), centralized and decentralized capacity markets and strategic reserves. The discussion will also contain the specific variation of the design options in some EU-countries and first experiences with alternative design options. Related to task T5.1.

result.title: Expert Workshop on energy system modelling with special focus on system flexibility
result.description: This deliverable provides a public workshop with a broader audience from science and relevant stakeholders on energy system modelling. Different modelling approaches and results from applied system models on flexibility analyses will be presented and discussed. Related to task T4.2 and T4.3.

result.title: REFLEX Public Website
result.description: A website will be established to support internal communication (see WP 8) and to present the project to stakeholders. It will provide all relevant information about the project, including the project idea and vision, the research focus, the consortium and main results. Furthermore, a download portal will be integrated in the website to provide access to the data (catalogue) as well as to reports and policy briefs prepared in the project. Related to tasks T7.1 - T7.4
